data.quote: Everybody should believe in something  I believe I'll have another drink.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: I know lots more old drunks than old doctors.
data.author: Joe E. Lewis

data.quote: I'm a one-drink woman  two at the most  three I'm under the table  four I'm under the host.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: My doctor said I look like a million dollars - green and wrinkled.
data.author: Red Skelton

data.quote: Condoms aren't completely safe. A friend of mine was wearing one . . . and got hit by a bus.
data.author: Bob Rubin

data.quote: My doctor gave me six months to live  but when I couldn't pay the bill  he gave me six months more.
data.author: Walter Mattbau

data.quote: I can't believe that out of a hundred thousand sperm  you were the quickest.
data.author: Steven Pearl

data.quote: I hope you live to be as old as your jokes.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: My wife is the most wonderful woman in the world  and that's not just my opinion - it's hers.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: she: Before we got married  you told me you were well-off. he: I was  and I didn't know it.
data.author: Jacob Braude

data.quote: A good marriage would be between a blind wife and a deaf husband.
data.author: Michel de Montaigne

data.quote: Why did God make man before he made woman? Because he didn't want any advice on how to do it.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: When all else is lost  the future still remains.
data.author: Christian Nestell Bovee

data.quote: Tis the sunset of life gives me mystical lore  And coming events cast their shadows before.
data.author: Thomas Campbell

data.quote: I never think of the future. It comes soon enough.
data.author: Albert Einstein

data.quote: I know of no way of judging the future but by the past.
data.author: Patrick Henry

data.quote: The present is great with the future
data.author: Baron von Leibnitz

data.quote: Trust no Future  howe'er pleasant! Let the dead Past bury its dead!
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: Go forth to meet the shadowy Future without fear and with a manly heart.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: Take therefore no thought for the morrow  for the morrow shall take thought for the things of itself. Sufficient unto the day is the evil thereof.
data.author: Matthew

data.quote: There was the Door to which I found no key  There was the Veil through which I might not see.
data.author: Omar Khayyam

data.quote: There was a wise man in the East whose constant prayer was that he might see today with the eyes of tomorrow.
data.author: Alfred Mercier

data.quote: I believe the future is only the past again  entered through another gate.
data.author: Arthur Wing Pinero

data.quote: Till the sun grows cold  And the stars are old  And the leaves of the Judgment Book unfold.
data.author: Bayard Taylor

data.quote: The race is not always to the swift nor the battle to the strong - but that's the way to bet.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: There is but one good throw upon the dice  which is to throw them away.
data.author: Paul Chatfield

data.quote: By gaming we lose both our time and treasure - two things most precious to the life of man.
data.author: Owen Felltham

data.quote: Man is a gaming animal.
data.author: Charles Lamb

data.quote: Keep flax from fire  youth from gaming.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: It [gaming] is the child of avarice  the brother of iniquity  and the father of mischief.
data.author: George Washington

data.quote: Play out the game  act well your part  and if the gods have blundered  we will not.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Business is more exciting than any game.
data.author: Lord Beaverbrook

data.quote: Divorce is a game played by lawyers.
data.author: Cary Grant

data.quote: Poetry is a mug's game.
data.author: T. S. Eliot

data.quote: The game isn't over until it's over.
data.author: Yogi Berra

data.quote: I never lost a game. I just ran out of time.
data.author: Bobby Layne

data.quote: Most ball games are lost  not won.
data.author: Casey Stengel

data.quote: In the game of life nothing is less important than the score at half time.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The game of life is not so much in holding a good hand as playing a poor hand well.
data.author: H. T. Leslie

data.quote: The game is not worth the candle.

data.quote: A garden is a lovesome thing - God wot! Rose plot  Fringed pool  Fern grot -  The veriest school Of peace  and yet the fool Contends that God is not. -  Not God in gardens! When the sun is cool? Nay  but I have a sign! 'Tis very sure God walks in mine.
data.author: Thomas Edward Brown

data.quote: God the first garden made  and the first city Cain.
data.author: Abraham Cowley

data.quote: The Lord God planted a garden eastward in Eden  and there he put the man whom he had formed.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: One is nearer God's heart in a garden Than anywhere else on earth.
data.author: Dorothy Frances Gurney

data.quote: The difference between genius and stupidity is that genius has its limits.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The genius of Einstein leads to Hiroshima.
data.author: Pablo Picasso

data.quote: Genius  in truth  means little more than the faculty of perceiving in an unhabitual way.
data.author: William James

data.quote: Genius as such can neither be explained nor treated away  only  at times  its delay and inhibition and its perversion to destructive or self-destructive ends.
data.author: Erik Erikson

data.quote: To believe your own thought  to believe that what is true for you in your private heart is true for all men - that is genius.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Doing easily what others find is difficult is talent  doing what is impossible for talent is genius.
data.author: Henri Frederic Amiel

data.quote: It takes immense genius to represent  simply and sincerely  what we see in front of us.
data.author: Edmond Duranty

data.quote: Results! Why  man  I have gotten a lot of results. I know several thousand things that won't work.
data.author: Thomas A. Edison

data.quote: The parting genius is with sighing sent.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Every man of genius is considerably helped by being dead.
data.author: Robert S. Lund

data.quote: In the republic of mediocrity  genius is dangerous.
data.author: Robert G. Ingersoll

data.quote: We define genius as the capacity for productive reaction against one's training.
data.author: Bernard Berenson

data.quote: Before I was a genius I was a drudge.
data.author: Ignace Jan Paderewski

data.quote: In every work of genius we recognize our own rejected thoughts  they come back to us with a certain alienated majesty.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Genius develops in quiet places  character out in the full current of human life.
data.author: Goethe

data.quote: Men of genius are the worst possible models for men of talent.
data.author: Murray D. Edwards

data.quote: The public is wonderfully tolerant. It forgives everything except genius.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: When a true genius appears in the world you may know him by this sign  that the dunces are all in confederacy against him.
data.author: Jonathan Swift

data.quote: Talent is that which is in a man's power  genius is that in whose power a man is.
data.author: James Russell Lowell

data.quote: There is a thin line between genius and insanity. I have erased this line.
data.author: Oscar Levant

data.quote: Improvement makes straight roads  but the crooked roads without improvement are roads of genius.
data.author: William Blake

data.quote: Geniuses are the luckiest of mortals because what they must do is the same as what they most want to do.
data.author: W. H. Auden

data.quote: Everyone is a genius at least once a year  a real genius has his original ideas closer together.
data.author: G. C. Lichtenberg

data.quote: The true genius is a mind of large general powers  accidentally determined to some particular direction.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: The mark of genius is an incessant activity of mind. Genius is a spiritual greed.
data.author: V. S. Pritchett

data.quote: Genius is an African who dreams up snow.
data.author: Vladimir Nabokov

data.quote: Sometimes men come by the name of genius in the same way that certain insects come by the name of centipede - not because they have a hundred feet  but because most people can't count above fourteen.
data.author: G. C. Lichtenberg

data.quote: Too often we forget that genius ... depends upon the data within its reach  that Archimedes could not have devised Edison's inventions.
data.author: Ernest Dimnet

data.quote: There is no great genius without a mixture of madness.
data.author: Aristotle

data.quote: Genius is only great patience.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Genius is one per cent inspiration and ninety-nine per cent perspiration.
data.author: Thomas Alva Edison

data.quote: Genius does what it must  and talent does what it can.
data.author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton

data.quote: Gift  like genius  I often think only means an infinite capacity for taking pains.
data.author: Ellice Hopkins

data.quote: Genius is a promontory jutting out of the infinite.
data.author: Victor Hugo

data.quote: Three-fifths of him genius and two-fifths sheer fudge.
data.author: James Russell Lowell

data.quote: The lamp of genius burns quicker than the lamp of life.
data.author: Friedrich von Schiller

data.quote: The poet's scrolls will outlive the monuments of stone. The Genius survives  all else is claimed by death.
data.author: Edmund Spenser

data.quote: A gentleman is man who can disagree without being disagreeable.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The gentleman is a Christian product.
data.author: George H. Calvert

data.quote: Once a gentleman  always a gentleman.
data.author: Charles Dickens

data.quote: Propriety of manners and consideration for others are the two main characteristics of a gentleman.
data.author: Benjamin Disraeli

data.quote: To make a fine gentleman  several trades are required  but chiefly a barber.
data.author: Oliver Goldsmith

data.quote: Let us put Germany  so to speak  in the saddle! you will see that she can ride.
data.author: Otto von Bismarck

data.quote: We Germans will never produce another Goethe  but we may produce another Caesar.
data.author: Oswald Spengler

data.quote: Act decidedly and take the consequences. No good is ever done by hesitation.
data.author: Thomas Henry Huxley

data.quote: How lovely to think that no one need wait a moment  we can start now  start slowly changing the world!
data.author: Anne Frank

data.quote: To know what has to be done  then do it  comprises the whole philosophy of practical life.
data.author: Sir William Osier

data.quote: If you want to do something  do it!
data.author: Plautus

data.quote: Something must happen!
data.author: Heinrich Boll

data.quote: Putting off an easy thing makes it hard. Putting off a hard thing makes it impossible.
data.author: George Claude Lorimer

data.quote: Delay always breeds danger  and to protract a great design is often to ruin it.
data.author: Miguel de Cervantes

data.quote: The wise man does at once what the fool does finally.
data.author: Baltasar Gracian

data.quote: In putting off what one has to do  one runs the risk of never being able to do it.
data.author: Charles Baudelaire

data.quote: Getting an idea should be like sitting down on a pin  it should make you jump up and do something.
data.author: E. L. Simpson

data.quote: Procrastination is opportunity's assassin.
data.author: Victor Kiam

data.quote: To do anything in this world worth doing  we must not stand back shivering and thinking of the cold and danger  but jump in and scramble through as well as we can.
data.author: Sydney Smith

data.quote: The man who will not execute his resolutions when they are fresh upon him can have no hope from them afterwards  they will be dissipated  lost and perish in the hurry and scurry of the world  or sunk in the slough of indolence.
data.author: Maria Edgeworth

data.quote: Why always  "not yet"? Do flowers in spring say  "not yet"?
data.author: Norman Douglas

data.quote: We are very near to greatness: one step and we are safe  can we not take the leap?
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: The keen spirit seizes the prompt occasion.
data.author: Hannah Moore

data.quote: The hour is ripe  and yonder lies the way.
data.author: Virgil

data.quote: Delay not to seize the hour!
data.author: Aeschylus

data.quote: I was seldom able to see an opportunity until it had ceased to be one.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: This one makes a net  this one stands and wishes. Would you like to make a bet which one gets the fishes?
data.author: Chinese rhyme

data.quote: Inspirations never go in for long engagements  they demand immediate marriage to action.
data.author: Brendan Francis

data.quote: If we really want to live  we'd better start at once to try.
data.author: W. H. Auden

data.quote: The rewards in business go to the man who does something with an idea.
data.author: William Benton

data.quote: The important thing is somehow to begin.
data.author: Henry Moore

data.quote: Eighty percent of success is showing up.
data.author: Woody Allen

data.quote: As long as you can start  you are all right. The juice will come.
data.author: Ernest Hemingway

data.quote: The way to get ahead is to start now.
data.author: William Feather

data.quote: Begin doing what you want to do now.
data.author: Marie Beynon Ray

data.quote: It is no good hearing an inner voice or getting an inner prompting if you do not immediately act on that inner prompting.
data.author: David Spangler

data.quote: Even if you're on the right track  you'll get run over if you just sit there.
data.author: Will Rogers

data.quote: The first step is the hardest.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The art of writing is the art of applying the seat of the pants to the seat of the chair.
data.author: Mary Heaton Vorse

data.quote: Every beginning is hard.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.
data.author: Chinese proverb

data.quote: Whenever you take a step forward  you are bound to disturb something.
data.author: Indira Gandhi

data.quote: If you miss the first buttonhole  you will not succeed in buttoning up your coat.
data.author: Johann von Goethe

data.quote: If you don't place your foot on the rope  you'll never cross the chasm.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: He who is outside the door has already a good part of his journey behind him.
data.author: Dutch proverb

data.quote: The beginning is half of every action.
data.author: Greek proverb

data.quote: The man who removes a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
data.author: Chinese proverb

data.quote: Everyone who got where he is had to begin where he was.
data.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

data.quote: Change your life today. Don't gamble on the future  act now  without delay.
data.author: Simone de Beauvoir

data.quote: The most important thing about getting somewhere is starting right where we are.
data.author: Bruce Barton

data.quote: Sometimes we look so intently toward the pinnacle that we stumble over the steps leading to it. Development begins just where you are.
data.author: Mrs. Herman Stanley

data.quote: Few begin with anything like a clear view of what they want to do  and the fortune they seek may come in a very different form from that which they have kept in view.
data.author: The Independent

data.quote: The most effective way to do it  is to do it.
data.author: Toni Cade Bambara

data.quote: Beginnings are apt to be shadowy.
data.author: Rachel Carson

data.quote: We will not know unless we begin.
data.author: Howard Zinn

data.quote: Let us watch well our beginnings  and results will manage themselves.
data.author: Alexander Clark

data.quote: You cannot contribute anything to the ideal condition of mind and heart known as Brotherhood  however much you preach  posture  or agree  unless you live it.
data.author: Faith Baldwin

data.quote: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
data.author: Sally Berger

data.quote: To always be intending to live a new life  but never to find time to set about it  this is as if a man should put off eating and drinking and sleeping from one day and night to another  till he is starved and destroyed.
data.author: John Tillotson

data.quote: To choose is also to begin.
data.author: Starhawk

data.quote: Knowing is not enough  we must apply. Willing is not enough  we must do.
data.author: Johann von Goethe

data.quote: Wisdom is harder to do than it is to know.
data.author: Yula Moses

data.quote: Justice is a concept. Muscle is the reality.
data.author: Linda Blandford

data.quote: No one has a right to sit down and feel hopeless. There's too much work to do.
data.author: Dorothy Day

data.quote: Do noble things  do not dream them all day long.
data.author: Charles Kingsley

data.quote: That is the principal thing: not to remain with the dream  with the intention  with the being in the mood  but always forcibly to convert it into all things.
data.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

data.quote: Don't wait for your "ship to come in " and feel angry and cheated when it doesn't. Get going with something small.
data.author: Irene Kassorla

data.quote: Don't sit down and wait for the opportunities to come  you have to get up and make them.
data.author: Madame C. J. Walker

data.quote: The individual activity of one man with backbone will do more than a thousand men with a mere wishbone.
data.author: William J. H. Boetcker

data.quote: With mere good intentions hell is proverbially paved.
data.author: William James

data.quote: All the beautiful sentiments in the world weigh less than a single lovely action.
data.author: James Russell Lowell

data.quote: It is vain to say human beings ought to be satisfied with tranquility: they must have action  and they will have it if they cannot find it.
data.author: George Eliot

data.quote: Now  go take on the day!
data.author: Dr. Laura Schlessinger

data.quote: You can't steal second base and keep one foot on first.
data.author: Frederick B. Wilson

data.quote: You cannot dream yourself into a character  you must hammer and forge one for yourself.
data.author: James A. Froude

data.quote: What the Puritans gave the world was not thought  but action.
data.author: Wendell Phillips

data.quote: Stagnation is something worse than death. It is corruption  also.
data.author: William Gilmore Simms

data.quote: I myself must mix with action  lest I wither by despair.
data.author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson

data.quote: Psychology is action  not thinking about oneself.
data.author: Albert Camus

data.quote: The great end of life is not knowledge  but action.
data.author: Thomas Henry Huxley

data.quote: The biggest sin is sitting on your ass.
data.author: Florynce Kennedy

data.quote: This is a world of action  and not for moping and droning in.
data.author: Charles Dickens

data.quote: Honors and rewards fall to those who show their good qualities in action.
data.author: Aristotle

data.quote: Share the passion and action of your time  at peril of being judged not to have lived.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.

data.quote: Action is eloquence.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: The shortest answer is doing.
data.author: English proverb

data.quote: The end of man is action.
data.author: Thomas Carlyle

data.quote: Optimism  unaccompanied by personal effort  is merely a state of mind  and not fruitful.
data.author: Edward L. Curtis

data.quote: To attain happiness in another world we need only to believe something  while to secure it in this world  we must do something.
data.author: Charlotte P. Gilman

data.quote: The only menace is inertia.
data.author: Saint John Perse

data.quote: One of the reasons why so few of us ever act  instead of react  is because we are continually stifling our deepest impulses.
data.author: Henry Miller

data.quote: If a man wants his dreams to come true  he must wake them up.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Men expect too much  do too little.
data.author: Allen Tate

data.quote: Action may not always bring happiness  but there is no happiness without action.
data.author: William James

data.quote: Things don't turn up in this world until somebody turns them up.
data.author: James A. Garfield

data.quote: Act-act in the living present!
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: Life is essentially a series of events to be lived through rather than intellectual riddles to be played with and solved.
data.author: George A. Buttrick

data.quote: There are risks and costs to a program of action. But they are far less than the long-range risks and costs of comfortable inaction.
data.author: John F. Kennedy

data.quote: What you don't do can be a destructive force.
data.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

data.quote: He that is overcautious will accomplish little.
data.author: J. C. F. von Schiller

data.quote: Untilled ground  however rich  will bring forth thistles and thorns  so also the mind of man.
data.author: Therese of Lisieux

data.quote: Often greater risk is involved in postponement than in making a wrong decision.
data.author: Harry A. Hopf

data.quote: The bitterest tears shed over graves are for words left unsaid and deeds left undone.
data.author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

data.quote: And all that you are sorry for is what you haven't done.
data.author: Margaret Widdemer

data.quote: Can anything be sadder than work unfinished? Yes  work never begun.
data.author: Christina Rossetti

data.quote: The only things you regret are the things you didn't do.
data.author: Michael Curtiz

data.quote: Above all  try something.
data.author: Franklin Delano Roosevelt

data.quote: To avoid an occasion for our virtues is a worse degree of failure than to push forward pluckily and make a fall.
data.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

data.quote: Indifference and inaction must always pay a penalty.
data.author: William Feather

data.quote: Shun idleness. It is a rust that attaches itself to the most brilliant metals.
data.author: Voltaire

data.quote: I do not believe in a fate that falls on men however they act  but I do believe in a fate that falls on men unless they act.
data.author: G. K. Chesterton

data.quote: The real nature of an ethic is that it does not become an ethic unless and until it goes into action.
data.author: Margaret Halsey

data.quote: For it isn't enough to talk about peace. One must believe in it. And it isn't enough to believe in it. One must work at it.
data.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

data.quote: Words are mere bubbles of water  but deeds are drops of gold.
data.author: Chinese proverb

data.quote: Ef women want any rights more'n dey got  why don't dey jes' take 'em and not be talkin' about it.
data.author: Sojourner Truth

data.quote: All talk of women's rights is moonshine. Women have every right. They have only to exercise them.
data.author: Victoria Claffin Woodhull

data.quote: A man of words and not of deeds is like a garden full of weeds.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Life is worth being lived  but not worth being discussed all the time.
data.author: Isabelle Adfani

data.quote: Action  not words  are the true criterion of the attachment of friends.
data.author: George Washington

data.quote: Words without actions are the assassins of idealism.
data.author: Herbert Hoover

data.quote: If you have something to do that is worthwhile doing  don't talk about it ... do it.
data.author: George W. Biount

data.quote: If deeds are wanting  all words appear mere vanity and emptiness.
data.author: Greek proverb

data.quote: Talking is easy  action difficult.
data.author: Spanish proverb

data.quote: One's feelings waste themselves in words  they ought all to be distilled into action ... which bring results.
data.author: Florence Nightingale

data.quote: Boast not of what thou would'st have done  but do.
data.author: John Milton

data.quote: I like to deliver more than I promise instead of the other way around.
data.author: Dorothy Uhnak

data.quote: When I talked  no one listened to me. But as soon as I acted I became persuasive  and I no longer find anyone incredulous.
data.author: Giosue Borsi

data.quote: If you can talk brilliantly about a problem  it can create the consoling illusion that it has been mastered.
data.author: Stanley Kubrick

data.quote: Words gain credibility by deed.
data.author: Terence

data.quote: Men are alike in their promises. It is only in their deeds that they differ.
data.author: Moliere

data.quote: An acre of performance is worth a whole world of promise.
data.author: W. D. Howells

data.quote: Well done is better than well said.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: Our chief defect is that we are more given to talking about things than to doing them.
data.author: Jawaharlal Nehru

data.quote: We have too many sounding words and too few actions that correspond with them.
data.author: Abigail Adams

data.quote: Activity in back of a very small idea will produce more than inactivity and the planning of a genius.
data.author: James A. Worsham

data.quote: When it comes to getting things done  we need fewer architects and more bricklayers.
data.author: Colleen C. Barrett

data.quote: Get good counsel before you begin  and when you have decided  act promptly.
data.author: Sallust

data.quote: Ideas are one thing  and what happens is another.
data.author: John Cage

data.quote: Thinking about swimming isn't much like actually getting in the water. Actually getting in the water can take your breath away.
data.author: Barbara Sher

data.quote: All worthwhile men have good thoughts  good ideas and good intentions  but precious few of them ever translate those into action.
data.author: John Hancock Field

data.quote: A thought which does not result in an action is nothing much  and an action which does not proceed from a thought is nothing at all.
data.author: Georges Bernanos

data.quote: To think is easy. To act is difficult. To act as one thinks is the most difficult of all.
data.author: Johann von Goethe

data.quote: Unless a capacity for thinking be accompanied by a capacity for action  a superior mind exists in torture.
data.author: Benedetto Croce

data.quote: Contemplation often makes life miserable. We should act more  think less  and stop watching ourselves live.
data.author: Nicolas de Chamfort

data.quote: What you theoretically know  vividly realize.
data.author: Francis Thompson

data.quote: We must not waste life in devising means. It is better to plan less and do more.
data.author: William Ellery Channing

data.quote: The best way to prepare for life is to begin to live.
data.author: Elbert Hubbard

data.quote: We are always getting ready to live  but never living.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Action will remove the doubt that theory cannot solve.
data.author: Tehyi Hsieh

data.quote: It is a common observation that those who dwell continually upon their expectations are apt to become oblivious to the requirements of their actual situation.
data.author: Charles Sanders Peirce

data.quote: He who deliberates fully before taking a step will spend his entire life on one leg.
data.author: Chinese proverb

data.quote: We don't have enough time to premeditate all our actions.
data.author: Vauvenargues

data.quote: The opportunity is often lost by deliberating.
data.author: Publilius Syrus

data.quote: To think too long about doing a thing often becomes its undoing.
data.author: Eva Young

data.quote: Do not wait for ideal circumstances  nor the best opportunities  they will never come.
data.author: Janet Erskine Stuart

data.quote: Do what you can  with what you have  where you are.
data.author: Theodore Roosevelt

data.quote: Anything worth doing is worth doing too soon.
data.author: Barbara Sher

data.quote: "Now" is the operative word. Everything you put in your way is just a method of putting off the hour when you could actually be doing your dream.
data.author: Barbara Sher

data.quote: Common sense does not ask an impossible chessboard  but takes the one before it and plays the game.
data.author: Wendell Phillips

data.quote: I don't wait for moods. You accomplish nothing if you do that. Your mind must know it has got to get down to earth.
data.author: Pearl S. Buck

data.quote: My evil genius Procrastination has whispered me to tarry 'til a more convenient season.
data.author: Mary Todd Lincoln

data.quote: I realize that if I wait until I am no longer afraid to act  write  speak  be  I'll be sending messages on a ouija board  cryptic complaints from the other side.
data.author: Audre Lorde

data.quote: He who postpones the hour of living is like the rustic who waits for the river to run out before he crosses.
data.author: Horace

data.quote: Being unready and ill-equipped is what you have to expect in life. It is the universal predicament. It is your lot as a human being to lack what it takes. Circumstances are seldom right. You never have the capacities  the strength  the wisdom  the virtue you ought to have. You must always do with less than you need in a situation vastly different from what you would have chosen.
data.author: Charlton Ogburn

data.quote: He who hesitates is last.
data.author: Mae West

data.quote: Conditions are never just right. People who delay action until all factors are favorable do nothing.
data.author: William Feather

data.quote: You decide you'll wait for your pitch. Then as the ball starts toward the plate  you think about your stance. And then you think about your swing. And then you realize that the ball that went past you for a strike was your pitch.
data.author: Bobby Murcer

data.quote: So what do we do? Anything. Something. So long as we just don't sit there. If we screw it up  start over. Try something else. If we wait until we've satisfied all the uncertainties  it may be too late.
data.author: Lee Iacocca

data.quote: Nothing at all will be attempted if all possible objections must first be overcome.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: No age or time of life  no position or circumstance  has a monopoly on success. Any age is the right age to start doing!
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Everyone must row with the oars he has.
data.author: English proverb

data.quote: The question for each man is not what he would do if he had the means  time  influence and educational advantages  but what he will do with the things he has.
data.author: Frank Hamilton

data.quote: How many opportunities come along? If you wait for the right one  that's wrong  because it may never be right  and what have you got to lose? Even if it's a disaster  you've tried  you've learned something  you've had an adventure. And that doesn't mean you can't do it again.
data.author: Edward McCabe

data.quote: And now  Lord  what wait I for?
data.author: Bible

data.quote: We should be taught not to wait for inspiration to start a thing. Action always generates inspiration. Inspiration seldom generates action.
data.author: Frank Tibolt

data.quote: If you wait for inspiration you'll be standing on the corner after the parade is a mile down the street.
data.author: Ben Nicholas

data.quote: The best place to succeed is where you are with what you have.
data.author: Charles M. Schwab

data.quote: One of these days is none of these days.
data.author: H. G. Bohn

data.quote: Who waits until the wind shall silent keep Will never find the ready hour to sow.
data.author: Helen Hunt Jackson

data.quote: Begin somewhere  you cannot build a reputation on what you intend to do.
data.author: Liz Smith

data.quote: If you wait for the perfect moment when all is safe and assured  it may never arrive. Mountains will not be climbed  races won  or lasting happiness achieved.
data.author: Maurice Chevalier

data.quote: There is nothing to be gained by waiting for a better situation. You see where you are and you do what you can with that.
data.author: Jacob K. Javits

data.quote: It is in your act that you exist  not in your body. Your act is yourself  and there is no other you.
data.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

data.quote: The things people discard tell more about them than the things they keep.
data.author: Hilda Lawrence

data.quote: The test of any man lies in action.
data.author: Pindar

data.quote: Every action we take  everything we do  is either a victory or defeat in the struggle to become what we want to be.
data.author: Anne Bronte

data.quote: It's where we go  and what we do when we get there  that tells us who we are.
data.author: Joyce Carol Oates

data.quote: By his deeds we know a man.
data.author: African proverb

data.quote: A human being has no discernible character until he acts.
data.author: Constantine Nash

data.quote: What we make is more important than what we are  particularly if making is our profession.
data.author: Dorothy L. Sayers

data.quote: To do is to be.
data.author: Socrates

data.quote: You can't build a reputation on what you intend to do.
data.author: Liz Smith

data.quote: To be is to do.
data.author: Plato

data.quote: The way to do is to be.
data.author: Lao-Tzu

data.quote: The ordinary man is involved in action  the hero acts. An immense difference.
data.author: Henry Miller

data.quote: We judge ourselves by what we feel capable of doing  while others judge us by what we have already done.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: Our deeds determine us  as much as we determine our deeds.
data.author: George Eliot

data.quote: The emotions are not always subject to reason ... but they are always subject to action. When thoughts do not neutralize an undesirable emotion  action will.
data.author: William James

data.quote: Silences have a climax  when you have got to speak.
data.author: Elizabeth Bowen

data.quote: He who desires but acts not breeds pestilence.
data.author: William Blake

data.quote: When I am idle and shiftless  my affairs become confused  when I work  I get results ... not great results  but enough to encourage me.
data.author: Edgar Watson Howe

data.quote: To be busy with material affairs is the best preservative against reflection  fears  doubts ... all these things which stand in the way of achievement. I suppose a fellow proposing to cut his throat would experience a sort of relief while occupied in stropping his razor carefully.
data.author: Joseph Conrad

data.quote: Acting can work a peculiar magic on the actor ... it can cure you (at least for the length of a performance) of a whole variety of ailments. Migraine headaches  miserable colds or toothaches will suddenly disappear as you're up there going through your paces.
data.author: Barbara Harris

data.quote: It is only when I dally with what I am about  look back and aside instead of keeping my eyes straight forward  that I feel these cold sinkings of the heart. But the first broadside puts all to rights.
data.author: Sir Walter Scott

data.quote: Action is the antidote to despair.
data.author: Joan Baez

data.quote: Action is the only reality  not only reality  but morality as well.
data.author: Abbie Hoffman

data.quote: Performance releases pressure.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Wishing does not make a poor man rich.
data.author: Arab proverb

data.quote: You can't get rich sitting on the bench.
data.author: Phil Linz

data.quote: Action makes more fortunes than caution.
data.author: Vauvenargues

data.quote: For purposes of action  nothing is more useful than narrowness of thought combined with energy of will.
data.author: Henri Frederic Amiel

data.quote: How  then  find the courage for action?... By accepting the human condition more simply and candidly  by dreading troubles less  calculating less  hoping more.
data.author: Henri Frederic Amiel

data.quote: Necessity of action takes away the fear of the act.
data.author: Francis Quarles

data.quote: Commitment leads to action. Action brings your dream closer.
data.author: Marcia Wieder

data.quote: One starts an action simply because one must do something.
data.author: T. S. Eliot

data.quote: We couldn't possibly know where it would lead  but we knew it had to be done.
data.author: Betty Friedan

data.quote: It is more blessed to give than to receive.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: You give but little when you give of your possessions. It is when you give of yourself that you truly give.
data.author: Kahlil Gibran

data.quote: I make presents to the mother  but think of the daughter.
data.author: Goethe

data.quote: Give an inch  he'll take an ell.
data.author: Thomas Hobbes

data.quote: He gives twice who gives quickly.
data.author: Publius Mimus

data.quote: Or what man is there of you  whom if his son ask bread  will he give him a stone?
data.author: Matthew

data.quote: Rich gifts wax poor when givers prove unkind.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: I fear the Greeks  even when they bring gifts.
data.author: Virgil

data.quote: Behold  I do not give lectures or a little charity  When I give I give myself.
data.author: Walt Whitman

data.quote: There is one glory of the sun  and another glory of the moon  and another glory of the stars: for one star differeth from another star in glory.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The paths of glory lead but to the grave.
data.author: Thomas Gray

data.quote: Mine eyes have seen the coming of the glory of the Lord.
data.author: Julia Ward Howe

data.quote: O how quickly passes away the glory of the earth.
data.author: Thomas a Kempis

data.quote: One crowded hour of glorious life Is worth an age without a name.
data.author: Walter Scott

data.quote: God helps those who help themselves.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Man proposes  and God disposes.
data.author: Ariosto

data.quote: God's in His Heaven -  All's right with the world!
data.author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

data.quote: Fear that man who fears not God.
data.author: Abd-el-Kader

data.quote: Nearer  my God  to Thee - Nearer to Thee -  E'en though it be a cross That raiseth me  Still all my song shall be Nearer  my God  to Thee  Nearer to Thee!
data.author: Sarah Flower Adams

data.quote: I took a day to search for God  And found Him not. But as I trod By rocky ledge  through woods untamed  Just where one scarlet lily flamed  I saw His foot print in the sod.
data.author: Bliss Carman

data.quote: A picket frozen on duty  -  A mother starved for her brood -  Socrates drinking the hemlock  And Jesus on the rood  And millions who  humble and nameless  The straight  hard pathway trod  -  Some call it Consecration  And others call it God.
data.author: W. H. Carruth

data.quote: God hath chosen the foolish things of the world to confound the wise  and God hath chosen the weak things of the world to confound the things that are mighty.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: God moves in a mysterious way His wonders to perform  He plants his footsteps in the sea And rides upon the storm.
data.author: William Cowper

data.quote: God is incorporeal  divine  supreme  infinite Mind  Spirit  Soul  Principle  life  Truth  Love.
data.author: Mary Baker Eddy

data.quote: An honest God is the noblest work of man.
data.author: Charles J. Ingersoll

data.quote: "We trust  Sir  that God is on our side." "It is more important to know that we are on God's side."
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: A mighty fortress is our God  A bulwark never failing  Our helper he amid the flood Of mortal ills prevailing.
data.author: Martin Luther

data.quote: Everyone is in a small way the image of God.
data.author: Marcus Manilius

data.quote: What is it: is man only a blunder of God  or God only a blunder of man?
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: A God-intoxicated man.
data.author: Novalis

data.quote: He mounts the storm  and walks upon the wind.
data.author: Alexander Pope

data.quote: The heavens declare the glory of God  and the firmament showeth his handiwork.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: He maketh me to lie down in green pastures  he leadeth me beside the still warm waters.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: God is our refuge and strength  a very present help in trouble.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: There is no respect of persons with God.
data.author: Romans

data.quote: If God be for us  who can be against us?
data.author: Romans

data.quote: The divine essence itself is love and wisdom.
data.author: Emmanuel Swedenborg

data.quote: God  the Great Giver  can open the whole universe to our gaze in the narrow space of a single lane.
data.author: Rabindranath Tagore

data.quote: Rock of Ages  cleft for me  Let me hide myself in thee.
data.author: Augustus Toplady

data.quote: God tempers the wind to the shorn lamb.
data.author: Laurence Sterne

data.quote: If there were no God  it would be necessary to invent him.
data.author: Voltaire

data.quote: Give way to the Better if way to the Better there be  It exacts a full look at the Worst.
data.author: Thomas Hardy

data.quote: The significance of a man is not in what he attains but rather in what he longs to attain.
data.author: Kahlil Gibran

data.quote: Once you say you're going to settle for second  that's what happens to you in life  I find.
data.author: John F. Kennedy

data.quote: A successful individual typically sets his next goal somewhat but not too much above his last achievement. In this way he steadily raises his level of aspiration.
data.author: Kurt Lewin

data.quote: The most absurd and reckless aspirations have sometimes led to extraordinary success.
data.author: Vauvenargues

data.quote: All rising to great places is by a winding stair.
data.author: Francis Bacon

data.quote: The only thing to know is how to use your neuroses.
data.author: Arthur Adamov

data.quote: Every ceiling  when reached  becomes a floor  upon which one walks as a matter of course and prescriptive right.
data.author: Aldous Huxley

data.quote: We can always redeem the man who aspires and strives.
data.author: Goethe

data.quote: The world stands aside to let anyone pass who knows where he is going.
data.author: David Starr Jordan

data.quote: I have learned to have very modest goals for society and myself  things like clean air  green grass  children with bright eyes  not being pushed around  useful work that suits one's abilities  plain tasty food  and occasional satisfying nookie.
data.author: Paul Goodman

data.quote: If you would hit the mark  you must aim a little above it: Every arrow that flies feels the attraction of earth.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: Ah  but a man's reach should exceed his grasp  or what's a heaven for?
data.author: Robert Browning

data.quote: Before we set our hearts too much upon anything  let us examine how happy they are  who already possess it.
data.author: La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: Ours is a world where people don't know what they want and are willing to go through hell to get it.
data.author: Don Marquis

data.quote: Accept the place the divine providence has found for you  the society of your contemporaries  the connection of events.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Those who aim at great deeds must also suffer greatly.
data.author: Plutarch

data.quote: It is a mistake to look too far ahead. Only one link in the chain of destiny can be handled at a time.
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: Do not wish to be anything but what you are  and try to be that perfectly.
data.author: St. Francis de Sales

data.quote: This one thing I do  forgetting those things which are behind  and reaching forth unto those things which are before  I press toward the mark!
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Winning isn't everything  but wanting to win is.
data.author: Vince Lombardi

data.quote: It is no longer clear which way is up even if one wants to rise.
data.author: David Riesman

data.quote: Ambition is pitiless. Any merit that it cannot use it finds despicable.
data.author: Joseph Joubert

data.quote: Every man is said to have his peculiar ambition.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: Well is it known that ambition can creep as well as soar.
data.author: Edmund Burke

data.quote: Make no little plans  they have no magic to stir men's blood . . . Make big plans  aim high in hope and work.
data.author: Daniel H. Burnham

data.quote: An aim in life is the only fortune worth finding.
data.author: Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis

data.quote: You have to have a dream so you can get up in the morning.
data.author: Billy Wilder

data.quote: What an immense power over the life is the power of possessing distinct aims. The voice  the dress  the look  the very motions of a person  define and alter when he or she begins to live for a reason.
data.author: Elizabeth Stuart Phelps

data.quote: If I had one wish for my children  it would be that each of them would reach for goals that have meaning for them as individuals.
data.author: Lillian Carter

data.quote: The tragedy of life doesn't lie in not reaching your goal. The tragedy lies in having no goal to reach.
data.author: Benjamin Mays

data.quote: Purpose is what gives life a meaning.
data.author: C. H. Parkhurst

data.quote: Nothing contributes so much to tranquilize the mind as a steady purpose-a point on which the soul may fix its intellectual eye.
data.author: Mary Wollstonecraft Shelley

data.quote: The poor man is not he who is without a cent  but he who is without a dream.
data.author: Harry Kemp

data.quote: He is conscious of touching the highest pinnacle of fulfillment... when he is consumed in the service of an idea  in the conquest of the goal pursued.
data.author: R. Briffault

data.quote: He who has a why to live for can bear almost any how.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: The great and glorious masterpiece of man is to know how to live to purpose.
data.author: Michel de Montaigne

data.quote: Great minds have purposes  others have wishes.
data.author: Washington Irving

data.quote: Unless you give yourself to some great cause  you haven't even begun to live.
data.author: William P. Merrill

data.quote: If we could only give  just once  the same amount of reflection to what we want to get out of life that we give to the question of what to do with a two weeks' vacation  we would be startled at our false standards and the aimless procession of our busy days.
data.author: Dorothy Canfield Fisher

data.quote: Be a life long or short  its completeness depends on what it was lived for.
data.author: David Starr Jordan

data.quote: To live means to have ... a mission to fulfill-and in the measure in which we avoid setting our life to something  we make it empty.
data.author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

data.quote: To seek one's goals and to drive toward it  steeling one's heart  is most uplifting!
data.author: Henrik Ibsen

data.quote: The true worth of a man is to be measured by the objects he pursues.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: A useless life is an early death.
data.author: Johann von Goethe

data.quote: My father used to play with my brother and me in the yard. Mother would come out and say  "You're tearing up the grass." "We're not raising grass " Dad would reply. "We're raising boys."
data.author: Harmon Killebrew

data.quote: Without a purpose  nothing should be done.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: To grow and know what one is growing towards-that is the source of all strength and confidence in life.
data.author: James Baillie

data.quote: Our plans miscarry because they have no aim. When a man does not know what harbor he is making for  no wind is the right wind.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: Every true man  sir  who is a little above the level of the beasts and plants  lives so as to give a meaning and a value to his own life.
data.author: Luigi Pirandello

data.quote: Men cannot for long live hopefully unless they are embarked upon some great unifying enterprise  one for which they may pledge their lives  their fortunes and their honor.
data.author: C. A. Dykstra

data.quote: No pleasure philosophy  no sensuality  no place nor power  no material success can for a moment give such inner satisfaction as the sense of living for good purpose.
data.author: Minot Simons

data.quote: Many are stubborn in pursuit of the path they have chosen  few in pursuit of the goal.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: There is one thing which gives radiance to everything. It is the idea of something around the corner.
data.author: G. K. Chesterton

data.quote: Lack of something to feel important about is almost the greatest tragedy a man may have.
data.author: Charles C. Noble

data.quote: There are three ingredients in the good life: learning  earning and yearning.
data.author: Christopher Morley

data.quote: If you cry "Forward " you must make plain in what direction to go.
data.author: Anton Chekhov

data.quote: Men  like nails  lose their usefulness when they lose direction and begin to bend.
data.author: Walter Savage Landor

data.quote: A novelist must know what his last chapter is going to say and one way or another work toward that last chapter. ... To me it is utterly basic  yet it seems like it's a great secret.
data.author: Leon Uris

data.quote: Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off the goal.
data.author: Hannah More

data.quote: You must have long-range goals to keep you from being frustrated by short-range failures.
data.author: Charles C. Noble

data.quote: The world stands aside to let anyone pass who knows where he is going.
data.author: David Starr Jordan

data.quote: This is true joy of life-the being used for a purpose that is recognized by yourself as a right one  instead of being a feverish  selfish little clod of ailments and grievances  complaining that the world will not devote itself to making you happy.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: Not only must we be good  but we must also be good for something.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: It is when things go hardest  when life becomes most trying  that there is greatest need for having a fixed goal. When few comforts come from without  it is all the more necessary to have a fount to draw on from within.
data.author: B. C. Forbes

data.quote: In everything one must consider the end.
data.author: Jean de la Fontaine

data.quote: A straight path never leads anywhere except to the objective.
data.author: Andre Gide

data.quote: There's some end at last for the man who follows a path  mere rambling is interminable.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: Having a goal is a state of happiness.
data.author: E. J. Bartek

data.quote: The American people can have anything they want  the trouble is  they don't know what they want.
data.author: Eugene V. Debs

data.quote: Life has a meaning only if one barters it day by day for something other than itself.
data.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

data.quote: To have a reason to get up in the morning  it is necessary to possess a guiding principle. A belief of some kind. A bumper sticker  if you will.
data.author: Judith Guest

data.quote: An aspiration is a joy forever  a possession as solid as a landed estate  a fortune which we can never exhaust and which gives us year by year a revenue of pleasurable activity.
data.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

data.quote: The soul that has no established aim loses itself.
data.author: Michel de Montaigne

data.quote: Life has a value only when it has something valuable as its object.
data.author: George Hegel

data.quote: He turns not back who is bound to a star.
data.author: Leonardo da Vinci

data.quote: He might never really do what he said  but at least he had it in mind. He had somewhere to go.
data.author: Louis L'Amour

data.quote: The great and glorious masterpiece of man is how to live with a purpose.
data.author: Michel de Montaigne

data.quote: What most counts is not to live  but to live aright.

data.quote: Choosing a goal and sticking to it changes everything.
data.author: Scott Reed

data.quote: No wind serves him who addresses his voyage to no certain port.
data.author: Michel de Montaigne

data.quote: Laboring toward distant aims sets the mind in a higher key  and puts us at our best.
data.author: C. H. Parkhurst

data.quote: Everything's in the mind. That's where it all starts. Knowing what you want is the first step toward getting it.
data.author: Mae West

data.quote: Set short term goals and you'll win games. Set long term goals and you'll win championships!
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: We act as though comfort and luxury were the chief requirements of life  when all that we need to make us really happy is something to be enthusiastic about.
data.author: Charles Kingsley

data.quote: Unhappiness is in not knowing what we want and killing ourselves to get it.
data.author: Don Herold

data.quote: Having a dream isn't stupid. ... It's not having a dream that's stupid.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Happiness is the overcoming of not unknown obstacles toward a known goal.

data.quote: To have no set purpose in one's life is the harlotry of the will.

data.quote: There is no happiness except in the realization that we have accomplished something.
data.author: Henry Ford

data.quote: Strong lives are motivated by dynamic purposes.
data.author: Kenneth Hildebrand

data.quote: One of the sources of pride in being a human being is the ability to bear present frustrations in the interests of longer purposes.
data.author: Helen Merrell Lynd

data.quote: Only he who can see the invisible can do the impossible.
data.author: Frank Gaines

data.quote: If you don't know where you are going  how can you expect to get there?
data.author: Basil S. Walsh

data.quote: The only people who attain power are those who crave for it.
data.author: Erich Kastner

data.quote: Destiny is not a matter of chance  it is a matter of choice  it is not a thing to be waited for  it is a thing to be achieved.
data.author: William Jennings Bryan

data.quote: In this life we get only those things for which we hunt  for which we strive  and for which we are willing to sacrifice.

data.quote: You seldom get what you go after unless you know in advance what you want.

data.quote: Where no plan is laid  where the disposal of time is surrendered merely to the chance of incident  chaos will soon reign.
data.author: Victor Hugo

data.quote: A life that hasn't a definite plan is likely to become driftwood.

data.quote: Only he who keeps his eye fixed on the far horizon will find his right road.
data.author: Dag Hammarskjold

data.quote: Fortunate is the person who has developed the self-control to steer a straight course toward his objective in life  without being swayed from his purpose by either commendation or condemnation.
data.author: Napoleon Hill

data.quote: Nothing is more terrible than activity without insight.
data.author: Thomas Carlyle

data.quote: If we would only give  just once  the same amount of reflection to what we want to get out of life that we give to the question of what to do with a two weeks' vacation  we would be startled at our false standards and the aimless procession of our busy days.

data.quote: The purpose of life is a life of purpose.
data.author: Robert Byrne

data.quote: Aim at nothing and you'll succeed.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The purpose of life is life.
data.author: Karl Lagerfeld

data.quote: Goals are dreams with deadlines.

data.quote: So long as I believe I have to do certain things  I will just go right ahead. That's how I run my life.
data.author: Corazan Aquino

data.quote: A schedule defends from chaos and whim. It is a net for catching days. It is a scaffolding on which a worker can stand and labor with both hands at sections of time.

data.quote: You decide what it is you want to accomplish and then you lay out your plans to get there  and then you just do it. It's pretty straightforward.

data.quote: What does so-called success or failure matter if only you have succeeded in doing the thing you set out to do. The doing is all that really counts.

data.quote: Get out of the blocks  run your race  stay relaxed. If you run your race  you'll win. Channel your energy. Focus.

data.quote: Know what you want to do-then do it. Make straight for your goal and go undefeated in spirit to the end.

data.quote: There is a place in God's sun for the youth "farthest down" who has the vision  the determination  and the courage to reach it.
data.author: Mary McLeod Bethune

data.quote: Every man is said to have his peculiar ambition.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: We all live with the objective of being happy  our lives are all different  and yet the same.
data.author: Anne Frank

data.quote: Follow your bliss. Find where it is and don't be afraid to follow it.
data.author: Joseph Campbell

data.quote: You can't assume the responsibility for everything you do-or don't do.
data.author: Simone de Beauvoir

data.quote: There were angry men confronting me and I caught the flashing of defiant eyes  but above me and within me  there was a spirit stronger than them all.
data.author: Antoinette Brown Blackwell

data.quote: A woman finds the natural lay of the land almost unconsciously  and not feeling it incumbent on her to be guide and philosopher to any successor  she takes little pains to mark the route by which she is making her ascent.
data.author: Antoinette Brown Blackwell

data.quote: No matter what the competition is  I try to find a goal that day and better that goal.
data.author: Bonnie Blair

data.quote: It doesn't matter what anybody thinks of what I do. The clock doesn't lie.
data.author: Bonnie Blair

data.quote: You can have your titular recognition. I'll take money and power.
data.author: Helen Gurley Brown

data.quote: Normal is not something to aspire to  it's something to get away from.

data.quote: I'm always making a comeback but nobody ever tells me where I've been.

data.quote: Remember if people talk behind your back  it only means you're two steps ahead!

data.quote: It's a sign of your own worth sometimes if you are hated by the right people.

data.quote: For me it's the challenge-the challenge to try to beat myself or do better than I did in the past. I try to keep in mind not what I have accomplished but what I have to try to accomplish in the future.

data.quote: There's a very fine line between a groove and a rut  a fine line between eccentrics and people who are just plain nuts.
data.author: Christine Lavin

data.quote: Promises that you make to yourself are often like the Japanese plum tree-they bear no fruit.

data.quote: I am not sending messages with my feet. All I ever wanted was not to come up empty. I did it for the dough  and the old applause.

data.quote: First say to yourself what you would be  and then do what you have to do.

data.quote: I can honestly say that I was never affected by the question of the success of an undertaking. If I felt it was the right thing to do  I was for it regardless of the possible outcome.

data.quote: What exactly is success? For me it is to be found not in applause  but in the satisfaction of feeling that one is realizing one's ideal.

data.quote: We can do whatever we wish to do provided our wish is strong enough. ... What do you want most to do? That's what I have to keep asking myself  in the face of difficulties.

data.quote: To be what we are  and to become what we are capable of becoming  is the only end of life.

data.quote: You have to define success in your own way. What maintains your dignity and integrity and what is your life's plan  where do you want to put your efforts. I could be richer and more famous  but I would have to give up things that are of infinitely more value.

data.quote: You cannot do good work if you take your mind off the work to see how the community is taking it.
data.author: Dorothy L. Sayers

data.quote: When the shriveled skin of the ordinary is stuffed out with meaning  it satisfies the senses amazingly.
data.author: Virginia Woolf

data.quote: Our victory is sure to come  and I can endure anything but recreancy to principle.

data.quote: If you just set out to be liked  you would be prepared to compromise on anything at any time  and you would achieve nothing.

data.quote: Concentrate on finding your goal  then concentrate on reaching it.

data.quote: I'm not going to let my life revolve around losing weight. I have other things to do.

data.quote: He who wants to do everything will never do anything.

data.quote: There are people who want to be everywhere at once  and they get nowhere.
data.author: Carl Sandburg

data.quote: Leader and followers are both following the invisible leader-the common purpose.

data.quote: People can have many different kinds of pleasure. The real one is that for which they will forsake the others.

data.quote: Nations  like individuals  have to limit their objectives or take the consequences.
data.author: James Reston

data.quote: It is in self-limitation that a master first shows himself.
data.author: Johann von Goethe

data.quote: One cannot manage too many affairs: like pumpkins in the water  one pops up while you try to hold down the other.
data.author: Chinese proverb

data.quote: One principle reason why men are so often useless is that they ... divide and shift their attention among a multitude of objects and pursuits.

data.quote: I can tell you how to get what you want: You've just got to keep a thing in view and go for it and never let your eyes wander to right or left or up or down. And looking back is fatal.

data.quote: Who begins too much accomplishes little.

data.quote: Never try to catch two frogs with one hand.

data.quote: If you run after two hares  you will catch neither.

data.quote: The greyhound that starts many hares kills none.
data.author: Spanish proverb

data.quote: A bull does not enjoy fame in two herds.
data.author: Rhodesian proverb

data.quote: The man who seeks one thing in life  and but one May hope to achieve it before life be done. But he who seeks all things wherever he goes Only reaps from the hopes which around him he sows A harvest of barren regrets.
data.author: Owen Meredith

data.quote: Those who attain any excellence commonly spend life in one pursuit  for excellence is not often granted upon easier terms. -Samuel Johnson No man can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one  and love the other  or else he will hold to the one  and despise the other.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: He who wishes to fulfill his mission in the world must be a man of one idea  one great overmastering purpose  overshadowing all his aims  and guiding and controlling his entire life.
data.author: Julius Bate

data.quote: Firmness of purpose is one of the most necessary sinews of character and one of the best instruments of success. Without it  genius wastes its efforts in a maze of inconsistencies.
data.author: Lord Chesterfield

data.quote: A double-minded man is unstable in all his ways.... A determinate purpose in life  and a steady adhesion to it through all disadvantages  are indispensable conditions of success.
data.author: William M. Punshion

data.quote: If you would be Pope  you must think of nothing else.
data.author: Spanish proverb

data.quote: One should want only one thing and want it constantly. Then one is sure of getting it. But I desire everything  and consequently get nothing.

data.quote: I care not what your education is  elaborate or nothing  what your mental calibre is  great or small  that man who concentrates all his energies of body  mind and soul in one direction is a tremendous man.

data.quote: He who hunts two hares leaves one and loses the other.
data.author: Japanese proverb

data.quote: He who serves two masters has to lie to one.

data.quote: All animals except man know that the ultimate of life is to enjoy it.

data.quote: What does so-called success or failure matter if only you have succeeded in doing the thing you set out to do. The doing is all that really counts.

data.quote: Use your health  even to the point of wearing it out. That is what it is for. Spend all you have before you die  do not outlive yourself.

data.quote: Life exists for the love of music or beautiful things.

data.quote: There is only one meaning of life: the act of living itself.

data.quote: The main obligation is to amuse yourself.

data.quote: The state of the world today demands that women become less modest and dream/plan/act/risk on a larger scale.

data.quote: In the long run men hit only what they aim at. Therefore  though they should fall immediately  they had better aim at something high.

data.quote: Each time I leaped I seemed to touch the sky and when I regained earth it seemed to be mine alone.

data.quote: The tragedy of life doesn't lie in not reaching your goal. The tragedy lies in having no goal to reach. It isn't a calamity to die with dreams unfulfilled  but it is a calamity not to dream. It is not disgrace to reach the stars  but it is a disgrace to have no stars to reach for. Not failure  but low aim  is a sin.

data.quote: I have an almost complete disregard of precedent and a faith in the possibility of something better. It irritates me to be told how things always have been done. ... I defy the tyranny of precedent. I cannot afford the luxury of a closed mind. I go for anything new that might improve the past.

data.quote: It's not enough to just swing at the ball. You've got to loosen your girdle and really let it fly.

data.quote: The brain is wider than the sky.

data.quote: My motto: sans limites.

data.quote: A lot of young girls have looked to their career paths and have said they'd like to be chief. There's been a change in the limits people see.

data.author: Maria Goeppert Mayer

data.quote: Our being is subject to all the chances of life. There are so many things we are capable of  that we could be or do. The potentialities are so great that we never  any of us  are more than one-fourth fulfilled.

data.quote: What else are we gonna live by if not dreams? We need to believe in something. What would really drive us crazy is to believe this reality we run into every day is all there is. If I don't believe that there's a happy ending out there-that will-you-marry-me in the sky-I can't keep working today.
data.author: Jill Robinson

data.quote: People think that at the top there isn't much room. They tend to think of it as an Everest. My message is that there is tons of room at the top.
data.author: Margaret Thatcher

data.quote: I am always more interested in what I am about to do than in what I have already done.
data.author: Rachel Carson

data.quote: We have believed-and we do believe now-that freedom is indivisible  that peace is indivisible  that economic prosperity is indivisible.

data.quote: I always ask the question  "Is this what I want in my life?"

data.quote: Tell them that as soon as I can walk I'm going to fly!
data.author: Bessie Coleman

data.quote: He who demands little gets it.

data.quote: Unless in one thing or another we are straining toward perfection  we have forfeited our manhood.
data.author: Stephen McKenna

data.quote: It is necessary to try to surpass one's self always  this occupation ought to last as long as life.
data.author: Christina Augusta

data.quote: I was born to be a remarkable woman  it matters little in what way or how. ... I shall be famous or I will die.

data.quote: I never intended to become a run-of-the-mill person.
data.author: Barbara Jordaon

data.quote: There is only one real sin and that is to persuade oneself that the second best is anything but second best.
data.author: Doris Lessing

data.quote: Too low they build  who build beneath the stars.
data.author: Edward Young

data.quote: I have the same goal I've had ever since I was a little girl. I want to rule the world.
data.author: Madonna

data.quote: Your world is as big as you make it.

data.quote: Whatever course you have chosen for yourself  it will not be a chore but an adventure if you bring to it a sense of the glory of striving  if your sights are set far above the merely secure and mediocre.

data.quote: Once you say you're going to settle for second  that's what happens to you.
data.author: John F. Kennedy

data.quote: Aim at heaven and you get earth thrown in  aim at earth and you get neither.

data.quote: I truly believe that before I retire from public office  I'll be voting for a woman for president.
data.author: Barbara Mikulski

data.quote: We are all in the gutter  but some of us are looking at the stars.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: If I smashed the traditions it was because I knew no traditions.
data.author: Maude Adams

data.quote: Aim at perfection in everything  though in most things it is unattainable. However they who aim at it  and persevere  will come much nearer to it than those whose laziness and despondency make them give it up as unattainable.
data.author: Lord Chesterfield

data.quote: One may miss the mark by aiming too high  as too low.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: Shoot for the moon. Even if you miss it  you will land among the stars.
data.author: Les Brown

data.quote: We aim above the mark to hit the mark. Every act hath some falsehood or exaggeration in it.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Life is a petty thing unless it is moved by the indomitable urge to extend its boundaries.
data.author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

data.quote: Far away in the sunshine are my highest inspirations. I many not reach them  but I can look up and see the beauty  believe in them and try to follow where they lead.
data.author: Louisa May Alcott

data.quote: A man's worth is no greater than the worth of his ambitions.

data.quote: Not failure  but low aim  is crime.
data.author: James Russell Lowell

data.quote: On the human chessboard  all moves are possible.
data.author: Miriam Schiff

data.quote: Great is the road I climb  but... the garland offered by an easier effort is not worth the gathering.
data.author: Propertius

data.quote: I never took a position we were going to be a good ball club. I took the position we were going to be a winning ball club.

data.quote: Man's reach should exceed his grasp  or what's a heaven for?
data.author: Robert Browning

data.quote: Before you begin a thing  remind yourself that difficulties and delays quite impossible to foresee are ahead. ... You can only see one thing clearly and that is your goal. Form a mental vision of that and cling to it through thick and thin.
data.author: Kathleen Norris

data.quote: You have to erect a fence and say  "Okay  scale this."
data.author: Linda Ronstadt

data.quote: You can change your beliefs so they empower your dreams and desires. Create a strong belief in yourself and what you want.
data.author: Marcia Wieder

data.quote: Man can only receive what he sees himself receiving.
data.author: Florence Scovel Shinn

data.quote: A person can grow only as much as his horizon allows.
data.author: John Powell

data.quote: You must learn day by day  year by year  to broaden your horizon. The more things you love  the more you are interested in  the more you enjoy  the more you are indignant about  the more you have left when anything happens.
data.author: Ethel Barrymore

data.quote: Enjoyment is not a goal  it is a feeling that accompanies important ongoing activity.
data.author: Paul Goodman

data.quote: What our deepest self craves is not mere enjoyment  but some supreme purpose that will enlist all our powers and give unity and direction to our life.
data.author: Henry J. Golding

data.quote: The very first condition of lasting happiness is that a life should be full of purpose  aiming at something outside self.
data.author: Hugh Black

data.quote: The only true happiness comes from squandering ourselves for a purpose.
data.author: John Mason Brown

data.quote: There is more to life than just existing and having a pleasant time.
data.author: J. C. F. von Schiller

data.quote: Happiness is not the end of life  character is.
data.author: Henry Ward Beecher

data.quote: Many persons have a wrong idea of what constitutes true happiness. It is not attained through self-gratification  but through fidelity to a worthy purpose.
data.author: Helen Keller

data.quote: A good goal is like a strenuous exercise-it makes you stretch.
data.author: Mary Kay Ash

data.quote: It's weak and despicable to go on wanting things and not trying to get them.
data.author: Joanna Field

data.quote: Growth is not concerned with itself.
data.author: Meridel Le Sueur

data.quote: The self-confidence one builds from achieving difficult things and accomplishing goals is the most beautiful thing of all.
data.author: Madonna

data.quote: If ambition doesn't hurt you  you haven't got it.
data.author: Kathleen Norris

data.quote: We need to restore the full meaning of that old word  duty. It is the other side of rights.
data.author: Pearl S. Buck

data.quote: This is true joy of life-being used for a purpose that is recognized by yourself as a mighty one ... instead of being a feverish  selfish little clod of ailments and grievances  complaining that the world will not devote itself to making you happy.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: That is happiness: to be dissolved into something completely great.
data.author: Willa Cather

data.quote: I looked on child rearing not only as a work of love and duty but as a profession that was fully as interesting and challenging as any honorable profession in the world and one that demanded the best I could bring to it.
data.author: Rose Fitzgerald Kennedy

data.quote: Human happiness and moral duty are inseparably connected.
data.author: George Washington

data.quote: The measure of a life  after all  is not its duration  but its donation.
data.author: Corrie ten Boom

data.quote: When we ... devote ourselves to the strict and unsparing performance of duty  ihen happiness comes of itself.
data.author: Wilhelm von Humboldt

data.quote: Duties are what make life most worth living. Lacking them  you are not necessary to anyone.
data.author: Marlene Dietrich

data.quote: Seek happiness for its own sake  and you will not find it  seek for duty  and happiness will follow  as the shadow comes with the sunshine.
data.author: Tyron Edwards

data.quote: True happiness ... is not attained through self-gratification  but through fidelity to a worthy purpose.
data.author: Helen Keller

data.quote: The only true happiness comes from squandering ourselves for a purpose.
data.author: William Cowper

data.quote: True happiness  we are told  consists in getting out of one's self  but the point is not only to get out  you must stay out  and to stay out  you must have some absorbing errand.
data.author: Henry James

data.quote: Happiness is the natural flower of duty.
data.author: Phillips Brooks

data.quote: The happiest excitement in life is to be convinced that one is fighting for all one is worth on behalf of some clearly seen and deeply felt good.
data.author: Ruth Benedict

data.quote: The secret of living is to find ... the pivot of a concept on which you can make your stand.
data.author: Luigi Pirandello

data.quote: The only ones among you who will be really happy are those who will have sought and found how to serve.
data.author: Albert Schweitzer

data.quote: He who never sacrificed a present to a future good  or a personal to a general one  can speak of happiness only as the blind speak of color.
data.author: Horace Mann

data.quote: There is no happiness except in the realization that we have accomplished something.
data.author: Henry Ford

data.quote: The full-grown modern human being ... is conscious of touching the highest pinnacle of fulfillment... when he is consumed in the service of an idea  in the conquest of the goal pursued.
data.author: R. Briffault

data.quote: Happiness is essentially a state of going somewhere  wholeheartedly  one-directionally  without regret or reservation.
data.author: William H. Sheldon

data.quote: A man's happiness: to do the things proper to man.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: Happy the man who knows his duties!
data.author: Christian Furchtegott Gellert

data.quote: I believe half the unhappiness in life comes from people being afraid to go straight at things.
data.author: William J. Locke

data.quote: Happiness is the overcoming of not unknown obstacles toward a known goal.
data.author: L. Ron Hubbard

data.quote: Give a man health and a course to steer  and he'll never stop to trouble about whether he's happy or not.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: Having a goal is a state of happiness.

data.quote: Happiness lies in the joy of achievement and the thrill of creative effort.

data.quote: Without duty  life is soft and boneless.
data.author: Joseph Joubert

data.quote: Never mind your happiness  do your duty.
data.author: Will Durant

data.quote: I probably hold the distinction of being one movie star who  by all laws of logic  should never have made it. At each stage of my career  I lacked the experience.
data.author: Audrey Hepburn

data.quote: The man who succeeds above his fellows is the one who early in life discerns his object and toward that object habitually directs his powers. Even genius itself is but fine observation strengthened by fixity of purpose.

data.quote: If one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams  and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined  he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: A determinate purpose of life  and steady adhesion to it through all disadvantages  are indispensable conditions of success.

data.quote: The secret of success is constancy to purpose.

data.quote: The man who fails because he aims astray  or because he does not aim at all  is to be found everywhere.

data.quote: Life has ... taught me not to expect success to be the inevitable result of my endeavors. She taught me to seek sustenance from the endeavor itself  but to leave the result to God.

data.quote: The object of war is not to die for your country  but to make the other bastard die for his.

data.quote: The object of war is to survive it.

data.quote: If we want a free and peaceful world  if we want to make the deserts bloom and man grow to greater dignity as a human being-we can do it.

data.quote: The most comprehensive formulation of therapeutic goals is the striving for wholeheartedness: to be without pretense  to be emotionally sincere  to be able to put the whole of oneself into one's feelings  one's work  one's beliefs.

data.quote: I think the purpose of life is to be useful  to be responsible  to be honorable  to be compassionate. It is  after all  to matter: to count  to stand for something  to have made some difference that you lived at all.

data.quote: Only when men are connected to large  universal goals are they really happy-and one result of their happiness is a rush of creative activity.

data.quote: The great business of life is to be  to do  to do without  and to depart.

data.quote: The proper function of man is to live-not to exist.

data.quote: Life's objective is life itself.

data.quote: I seek the utmost pleasure and the least pain.
data.author: Plautus

data.quote: There are two things to aim at in life: first  to get what you want  and after that to enjoy it. Only the wisest of mankind achieve the second.

data.quote: I am searching for that which every man seeks-peace and rest.
data.author: Dante Alighieri

data.quote: Reach high  for stars lie hidden in your soul. Dream deep  for every dream precedes the goal.
