data.quote: Never undertake anything for which you wouldn't have the courage to ask the blessings of heaven.
data.author: Georg Christoph Lichtenberg

data.quote: The one thing worth living for is to keep one's soul pure.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: The greatest use of life is to spend it for something that will outlast it.
data.author: William James

data.quote: How to make God laugh. Tell him your future plans.
data.author: Woody Allen

data.quote: God enters by a private door into every individual.

data.quote: God gives the milk but not the pail.

data.quote: God Himself is not secure  having given man dominion over His work.

data.quote: God is a circle whose centre is everywhere and circumference nowhere.

data.quote: God is not dead but alive and well and working on a much less ambitious project.

data.quote: God pays  but not weekly wages.

data.quote: God seems to have the receiver off the hook.

data.quote: God uses lust to impel men to marry  ambition to office  avarice to earning  and fear to faith. God led me like an old blind goat.

data.quote: God will provide - if only God would provide until he provides.

data.quote: He maketh his sun to rise on the evil and on the good  and sendeth rain on the just and on the unjust.

data.quote: If Jesus was Jewish  how come he has a Mexican name?

data.quote: In the faces of men and women I see God and in my own face in the glass  I find letters from God dropt in the street  and every one is signed by God's name  and I leave them where they are  for I know that wheresoever I go others will punctually come for ever and ever.

data.quote: The glory of God is in man fully alive.
data.author: St. Irenaeus

data.quote: The Vatican is against surrogate mothers. Good thing they didn't have that rule when Jesus was born.

data.quote: The worst that you can say about him (God) is that basically he's an underachiever.

data.quote: Though the mills of God grind slowly  yet they grind exceeding small  Though with patience He stands waiting  with exactness grinds he all.

data.quote: Try thyself first  and after call in God. For to the worker God himself lends aid.

data.quote: By night an atheist half-believes in God.

data.quote: Lord  who art always the same  give that I know myself  give that I know Thee.
data.author: St. Augustine

data.quote: We have no choice but to be guilty God is unthinkable if we are innocent.
data.author: Archibald MacLeish

data.quote: Man appoints  and God disappoints.

data.quote: I am afraid I shall not find Him  but I shall still look for Him. If He exists  He may be appreciative of my efforts.

data.quote: The more of himself man attributes to God  the less he has left in himself.

data.quote: God tempers the wind to the shorn lamb.

data.quote: Every man thinks God is on his side. The rich and powerful know he is.

data.quote: Christ - an anarchist who succeeded.

data.quote: If God made us in his image  we have certainly returned the compliment.

data.quote: We know only that we are living in these bodies and have a vague idea  because we have heard it  and because our faith tells us so  that we possess souls. data.quote: I believe in the incomprehensibility of God.

data.quote: Every conjecture we can form with regard to the works of God has as little probability as the conjectures of a child with regard to the works of a man.

data.quote: God is incorporeal  divine  supreme  infinite. Mind  Spirit  Soul  Principle  Life  Truth  Love.

data.quote: "What do you think of God " the teacher asked. After a pause  the young pupil replied  "He's not a think  he's a feel."

data.quote: To them that ask  where have you seen the Gods  or how do you know for certain there are Gods  that you are so devout in their worship? I answer: Neither have I ever seen my own soul  and yet I respect and honor it.

data.quote: It is the heart which experiences God  not the reason.

data.quote: I always say my God will take care of me. If it's my time I'll go  and if it's not I won't. I feel that He really has a lot of important things for me to do. And He's going to make sure that I'm here to do them.

data.quote: God is like a mirror. The mirror never changes  but everybody who looks at it sees something different.

data.quote: The best thing must be to flee from all to the All.

data.quote: Hunting God is a great adventure.

data.quote: In the faces of men and women I see God.

data.quote: In every out-thrust headland  in every curving beach  in every grain of sand  there is the story of the earth.

data.quote: Fo those leaning on the sustaining infinite  today is big with blessings.

data.quote: The best remedy for those who are afraid  lonely  or unhappy is to go outside  somewhere where they can be quiet  alone with the heavens  nature  and God. Because only then does one feel that all is as it should be and that God wishes to see people happy  amidst the simple beauty of nature. As long as this exists  and it certainly always will  I know that then there will always be comfort for every sorrow  whatever the circumstances may be. And I firmly believe that nature brings solace in all troubles.

data.quote: Whoever falls from God's right hand is caught into His left.

data.quote: The things which are impossible with men are possible with God.

data.quote: I will not fear  for you are ever with me  and you will never leave me to face my perils alone.

data.quote: Walk boldly and wisely. ... There is a hand above that will help you on.

data.quote: God uses lust to impel men to marry  ambition to office  avarice to earning  and fear to faith. God led me like an old blind goat.

data.quote: An act of God was defined as "something which no reasonable man could have expected."

data.quote: Let God love you through others and let God love others through you.

data.quote: I have never understood why it should be considered derogatory to the Creator to suppose that He has a sense of humor.
data.author: William Ralph Inge

data.quote: Every law of matter or the body  supposed to govern man is rendered null and void by the law of Life  God.
data.author: Mary Baker Eddy

data.quote: Whom the heart of man shuts out  Sometimes the heart of God takes in.
data.author: James Russell Lowell

data.quote: I need nothing but God  and to lose myself in the heart of God.
data.author: Saint Margaret Mary Alacoque

data.quote: To love one that is great  is almost to be great one's self.

data.quote: I would rather walk with God in the dark than go alone in the light.
data.author: Mary Gardiner Brainard

data.quote: What we are is God's gift to us. What we become is our gift to God.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Gawd knows  and 'E won't split on a pal.

data.quote: Holy church-that mother who is also a queen because she is a king's bride.
data.author: Teresa of Avila

data.quote: "You are accepted!" ... accepted by that which is greater than you and the name of which you do not know. Do not ask the name now  perhaps you will know it later. Do not try to do anything  perhaps later you will do much. Do not seek for anything  do not perform anything  do not intend anything. Simply accept the fact that you are accepted.
data.author: Paul Tillich

data.quote: As in heaven Your will is punctually performed  so may it be done on earth by all creatures  particularly in me and by me.
data.author: Saint Elizabeth of Hungary

data.quote: Christ has made my soul beautiful with the jewels of grace and virtue.
data.author: Saint Agnes

data.quote: God delays  but doesn't forget.

data.quote: How is it  Lord  that we are cowards in everything save in opposing Thee?
data.author: Teresa of Avila

data.quote: God is clever  but not dishonest.

data.quote: Yet  in the maddening maze of things  And tossed by storm and flood  To one fixed trust my spirit clings  I know that God is good!

data.quote: I could be whatever I wanted to be if I trusted that music  that song  that vibration of God that was inside of me.

data.quote: The million little things that drop into your hands The small opportunities each day brings He leaves us free to use or abuse And goes unchanging along His silent way.

data.quote: The Father most tender  Father of all  my immense God-I His atom.
data.author: Elizabeth Ann Seton

data.quote: What is there in man so worthy of honor and reverence as this  that he is capable of contemplating something higher than his own reason  more sublime than the whole universe- that Spirit which alone is self-subsis-tent  from which all truth proceeds  without which there is no truth?

data.quote: I thank the goodness and the grace Which on my birth have smiled  And made me  in these Christian days  A happy Christian child.
data.author: Jane Taylor

data.quote: A consciousness of God releases the greatest power of all.
data.author: Ernest Holmes

data.quote: Above all am I convinced of the need  irrevocable and inescapable  of every human heart  for God. No matter how we try to escape  to lose ourselves in restless seeking  we cannot separate ourselves from our divine source. There is no substitute for God.
data.author: A. J. Cronin

data.quote: Talking about God is not at all the same thing as experiencing God  or acting out God through our lives.
data.author: Phillip Hewett

data.quote: The person who has a firm trust in the Supreme Being is powerful in his power  wise by his wisdom  happy by his happiness.
data.author: Joseph Addison

data.quote: God has not promised skies always blue  flower-strewn pathways all our lives through  God has not promised sun without rain  joy without sorrow  peace without pain. But God has promised strength for the day  rest for the labor  light for the way  Grace for the trials  help from above  unfailing sympathy  undying love.
data.author: Annie Johnson Flint

data.quote: Courage is not afraid to weep  and she is not afraid to pray  even when she is not sure who she is praying to.
data.author: J. Ruth Gendler

data.quote: God is no enemy to you. He asks no more than that He hear you call Him "Friend."
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Deep down in every man  woman and child  is the fundamental idea of God. It may be obscured by calamity  by pomp  by worship of other things  but in some form or other it is there. For faith in a Power greater than ourselves  and miraculous demonstrations of that power in human lives  are facts as old as man himself.
data.author: Alcoholics Anonymous

data.quote: Our human resources  as marshalled by the will  were not sufficient  they failed utterly.... Every day is a day when we must carry the vision of God's will into all our activities.
data.author: Alcoholics Anonymous

data.quote: Then comes the insight that All is God. One still realizes that the world is as it was  but it does not matter  it does not affect one's faith.
data.author: Abraham Heschel

data.quote: The experience of God  or in any case the possibility of experiencing God  is innate.
data.author: Alice Walker

data.quote: Before me  even as behind  God is  and all is well.
data.author: John Greenleaf Whittier

data.quote: Forgetfulness of self is remembrance of God.
data.author: Bayazid Al-Bistami

data.quote: Every morning I spend fifteen minutes filling my mind full of God  and so there's no room left for worry thoughts.
data.author: Howard Chandler Christy

data.quote: Darkness is strong  and so is Sin  But surely God endures forever!
data.author: James Russell Lowell

data.quote: I need nothing but God  and to lose myself in the heart of God.
data.author: Saint Margaret Mary Alacoque

data.quote: It is not my ability  but my response to God's ability  that counts.
data.author: Corrie ten Boom

data.quote: He is more within us than we are ourselves.
data.author: Elizabeth Ann Seton

data.quote: We have grasped the mystery of the atom and rejected the Sermon on the Mount.
data.author: General Omar N. Bradley

data.quote: The Ethiop gods have Ethiop lips  Bronze cheeks  and woolly hair  The Grecian gods are like the Greeks  As keen-eyed  cold and fair.
data.author: Walter Bageh

data.quote: There's a one-eyed yellow idol to the north of Khat-mandu  There's a little marble cross below the town  There's a broken-hearted woman tends the grave of Mad Carew  And die yellow god forever gazes down.
data.author: J. Milton Hayes

data.quote: Yet verily these issues lie on the lap of the gods.
data.author: Homer

data.quote: You shall not press down upon the brow of labor this crown of thorns - you shall not crucify mankind upon a cross of gold!
data.author: W. J. Bryan

data.quote: Gold begets in brethren hate  Gold in families debate  Gold does friendship separate  Gold does civil wars create.
data.author: Abraham Cowley

data.quote: Gold! Gold! Gold! Gold! Bright and yellow  hard and cold
data.author: Thomas Hood

data.quote: Accursed thirst for gold! what dost thou not compel mortals to do?
data.author: Virgil

data.quote: What you do not want others to do to you  do not do to others.
data.author: Confucius

data.quote: What thou thyself hatest  do to no man.
data.author: Apocrypha Tobit

data.quote: Do unto the other feller the way he'd like to do unto you an' do it fust.
data.author: Edward N. Westcott

data.quote: Whatsoever thou wouldst that men should not do to thee  do not do that to them.
data.author: Hillel Ha-Babli

data.quote: As ye would that men should do to you  do ye also to them likewise.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: We have committed the Golden Rule to memory  let us now commit it to life.
data.author: Edwin Markham

data.quote: All things whatsoever ye wou'd that men should do to you  do ye even so to them: for this is the law and the prophets.
data.author: Matthew

data.quote: Do not do unto others as you would that they should do unto you. Their tastes may not be the same.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: Good-humor makes all things tolerable.
data.author: Henry Ward Beecher

data.quote: The sunshine of the mind.
data.author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton

data.quote: Good-humor is goodness and wisdom combined.
data.author: Owen Meredith

data.quote: Bad is never good until worse happens.
data.author: Danish proverb

data.quote: Good and evil lie close together. Seek no artistic unity in character.
data.author: Lord Acton

data.quote: Gifts are hooks.
data.author: Martial

data.quote: Good things  when short  are twice as good.
data.author: Baltasar Gracian

data.quote: If I can in any way contribute to the Diversion or Improvement of the Country in which I live  I shall leave it  when I am summoned out of it  with the secret Satisfaction of thinking that I have not lived in vain.
data.author: Joseph Addison

data.quote: In nature  nothing can be given  all things are sold.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Teach us to give and not to count the cost.
data.author: Ignatius Loyola

data.quote: The meaning of good and bad  of better and worse  is simply helping or hurting.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Too long a sacrifice Can make a stone of the heart.
data.author: William Butler Yeats

data.quote: Unto whomsoever much is given  of him shall much be required.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: If a man wants to be of the greatest possible value to his fellow-creatures  let him begin the long  solitary task of perfecting himself.
data.author: Robertson Davies

data.quote: We'd all like a reputation for generosity and we'd all like to buy it cheap.
data.author: Mignon McLaughlin

data.quote: He who would do good to another  must do it in minute particulars.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: General good is the plea of the scoundrel  hypocite  flatterer.
data.author: William Blake

data.quote: The word 'good' has many meanings. For example  if a man were to shoot his grandmother at a range of five hundred yards  I should call him a good shot  but not necessarily a good man.
data.author: G. K. Chesterton

data.quote: I expect to pass though this world but once. Any good therefore that I can do  or any kindness that I can show to my fellow-creature  let me do it now. Let me not defer or neglect it  for I shall not pass this way again.
data.author: Stephen Grellet

data.quote: Pity costs nothin' and ain't worth nothin'.
data.author: Josh Billings

data.quote: That best portion of a good man's life  His little  nameless  unremembered acts Of kindness and of love.
data.author: William Wordsworth

data.quote: There is no man so good  who  were he to submit all his thoughts and actions to the laws  would not deserve hanging ten times in his life.
data.author: Michel de Montaigne

data.quote: Should not the giver be thankful that the receiver received? Is not giving a need? Is not receiving  mercy?
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: When thou doest alms  do not let thy left hand know what thy right hand doeth.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: No good deed ever goes unpunished.
data.author: Brooks Thomas

data.quote: Be good  sweet maid  and let who can be clever.
data.author: Charles Kingsley

data.quote: Good things are not done in a hurry.
data.author: German proverb

data.quote: Be charitable and indulgent to every one but thyself.
data.author: Joseph Joubert

data.quote: We are all here on earth to help others  what on earth the others are here for I don't know.
data.author: W. H. Auden

data.quote: Why is it that when people have no capacity for private usefulness they should be so anxious to serve the public?
data.author: Sara Jeannette Duncan

data.quote: I have found men more kind than I expected  and less just.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: Is not a patron one who looks with unconcern on a man struggling for life in the water  and  when he has reached ground  encumbers him with help?
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: There is so much good in the worst of us and so much bad in the best of us  that it's rather hard to tell which of us ought to reform the rest of us.
data.author: Sign in Springdalea

data.quote: Good men need no recommendation and bad men it wouldn't help.
data.author: Jewish proverb

data.quote: Real unselfishness consists in sharing the interests of others.
data.author: George Santayana

data.quote: I hate the giving of the hand unless the whole man accompanies it.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: If you're naturally kind  you attract a lot of people you don't like.
data.author: William Feather

data.quote: The good should be grateful to the bad - for providing the world with a basis for comparison.
data.author: Sven Halla

data.quote: All strangers and beggars are from Zeus  and a gift  though small  is precious.
data.author: Homer

data.quote: Behold! I do not give lectures on a little charity. When I give  I give myself.
data.author: Walt Whitman

data.quote: If a friend is in trouble  don't annoy him by asking if there is anything you can do. Think up something appropriate and do it.
data.author: Edgar Watson Howe

data.quote: The greatest pleasure I know is to do a good action by stealth  and to have it found out by accident.
data.author: Charles Lamb

data.quote: As Charles Lamb says  there is nothing so nice as doing good by stealth and being found out by accident  so I now say it is even nicer to make heroic decisions and to be prevented by 'circumstances beyond your control' from ever trying to execute them.
data.author: William James

data.quote: Giving is the highest expression of potency.
data.author: Erich Fromm

data.quote: If I knew ... that a man was coming to my house with the conscious design of doing me good  I should run for my life.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: If I've learned anything in my seventy years it's that nothing's as good or as bad as it appears.
data.author: Bushrod H. Campbell

data.quote: The Devil himself is good when he is pleased.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: Wise men appreciate all men  for they see the good in each and know how hard it is to make anything good.
data.author: Baltasar Gracian

data.quote: The only gift is a portion of thyself.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Take egotism out  and you would castrate the benefactor.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: It is one of the beautiful compensations of this life that no one can sincerely try to help another without helping himself.
data.author: Charles Dudley Warner

data.quote: No man deserves to be praised for his goodness unless he has the strength of character to be wicked. All other goodness is generally nothing but indolence or impotence of will.
data.author: La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: We know the good  we apprehend it clearly. But we can't bring it to achievement.
data.author: Euripides

data.quote: Generosity is the vanity of giving.
data.author: La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: My only policy is to profess evil and do good.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: For an inheritance to be really great  the hand of the defunct must not be seen.
data.author: Rene Char

data.quote: Fearful is the seductive power of goodness.
data.author: Bertolt Brecht

data.quote: There are bad people who would be less dangerous if they were quite devoid of goodness.
data.author: La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: The age of strong belief is over  the good is no longer always very good.
data.author: D. L. Coles

data.quote: When you cease to make a contribution you begin to die.
data.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

data.quote: For the cause that lacks assistance  The wrong that needs resistance  For the future in the distance  And the good that I can do.
data.author: George Linnaeus Banks

data.quote: Happy were men if they but understood There is no safety but in doing good.
data.author: John Fountain

data.quote: Can there any good thing come out of Nazareth?
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Be good  sweet maid  and let who will be clever  Do noble things  not dream them all day long  And so make life  death  and that vast forever One grand  sweet song.
data.author: Charles Kingsley

data.quote: The crest and crowning of all good  Life's final star  is Brotherhood.
data.author: Edwin Markham
